intro: Tetranthera resinosa, commonly known as the resinous tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera resinosa is known for producing a resinous substance, which has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
